This document summarizes the (a) themes and (b) findings from articles in the reading list relating to the assignment on Airbnb.

#### **1. Housing Affordability, Gentrification, and Urban Displacement**

-   [Barron, K., E. Kung, and D. Proserpio. 2018](https://static1.squarespace.com/static/5bb2d447a9ab951efbf6d10a/t/5bea6881562fa7934045a3f0/1542088837594/The+Sharing+Economy+and+Housing+Affordability.pdf.). “The Sharing Economy and Housing Affordability: Evidence from Airbnb.”

-   [Horn, K., and M. Merante. 2017](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/319400631_Is_Home_Sharing_Driving_Up_Rents_Evidence_from_Airbnb_in_Boston). “Is Home Sharing Driving up Rents? Evidence from Airbnb in Boston.” *Journal of Housing Economics* 38:14–24.

-   [Lee, D. 2016](https://journals.law.harvard.edu/lpr/wp-content/uploads/sites/89/2016/02/10.1_10_Lee.pdf). “How Airbnb Short-Term Rentals Exacerbate Los Angeles’s Affordable Housing Crisis: Analysis and Policy Recommendations.” *Harvard Law & Policy Review* 10 (1):229–54.

-   [Cocola-Gant, A., and A. Gago. 2019](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/0308518X19869012). “Airbnb, Buy-to-Let Investment and Tourism-Driven Displacement: A Case Study in Lisbon.” *Environment and Planning A: Economy and Space* 0 (0):1–18.

-   [Shabrina, Z., E. Arcaute, and M. Batty. 2019](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/332033983_Airbnb's_disruption_of_the_housing_structure_in_London). “Airbnb’s Disruption of the Housing Structure in London.” ArXiv Prepring. University College London.

-   [Gurran, N., and P. Phibbs. 2017](https://www-tandfonline-com.libproxy.ucl.ac.uk/doi/full/10.1080/01944363.2016.1249011). “When Tourists Move in: How Should Urban Planners Respond to Airbnb?” *Journal of the American Planning Association* 83 (1):80–92.

-   [Ferreri, Mara, and Romola Sanyal. 2018](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0042098017751982). “Platform Economies and Urban Planning: Airbnb and Regulated Deregulation in London.” *Urban Studies* 55 (15):3353–68.

-   [Bivens, J. 2019](https://www.epi.org/publication/the-economic-costs-and-benefits-of-airbnb-no-reason-for-local-policymakers-to-let-airbnb-bypass-tax-or-regulatory-obligations/). “The Economic Costs and Benefits of Airbnb.” *Economic Policy Institute*.

|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   82% of hosts had only one simultaneous listing on Airbnb in Boston, suggesting that most Airbnb hosts are occupants seeking extra income by renting. |                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Controls for (i) crime rates as proxy for popularity, (ii) building permits issued as proxy for physical improvements, (iii) restaurant licenses as proxy for amenities.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Home sharing both a personal and commercial enterprise - should be regulated as such.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

| [Lee (2016)](https://journals.law.harvard.edu/lpr/wp-content/uploads/sites/89/2016/02/10.1_10_Lee.pdf)                                                                                         | Los Angeles. Legal and policy analysis, review of Airbnb listings and city regulations.                                               | -   Airbnb distorts the housing market in two ways (a) conversion – unit previously occupied by city resident but now listed is unit removed from rental market, typically in core regions, reducing housing supply and affordable housing supply (b) hotelisation – incentive to list units for tourists over locals due to ‘rent-controlled rent’.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Results in bidding up of rents as public sector cannot swifty replace the housing units that Airbnb removes from the marketplace.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Particularly affects high density neighbourhoods, tight housing markets with near-zero vacancy rates, and could be exacerbated by annual increases in residential demand.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Leads to citywide reduction in affordable housing – given that affordable units are particularly attractive for conversion, reducing stock. Incentivizes the direct conversion of subsidised or rent-controlled units into lucrative Airbnb listings.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Other phenomena such as displacement, gentrification through rising rents, exacerbates social inequality through displacement of lower income tenants.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Policy recommendations: limit entire-home rentals, require registration, enforce data transparency, integrate short-term rental impacts into city planning.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

Investors enjoy steady rental yield and can sell asset tenant free at any moment.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Airbnb gives rise to a hyper-flexible rental market that amplifies insecurity and displacement concerns.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

Spatial analysis using geocoded Airbnb listings and housing data.                                                  | -   Spatial location of Airbnb rentals is negatively correlated with diversity of dwelling types and positively correlated with a single dwelling type – purpose-built flats, conversions and flats in commercial buildings.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                | Housing supply data from Valuation Office Agency (VOA) which counts number of houses in each LSOA.                                    | -   Airbnb concentrated in areas with high proportion of privately rented properties, detracting more than 14% of housing supply to short-term rentals, and up to 20% in some neighbourhoods.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                | LSOA type of homeownership data from UK Census 2011, which provides summary of areas with proportion of each type of homeownership.   | -   Highlights the unique context of London’s housing market (a) prolonged decline in new homes constructed since 1970s, leading to housing shortfall, and supply constraints. (b) scarcity of developable land in London (c) regulatory constraints and housing policies that seeks to target first-time buyers pushes prices up further due to increase in demand that outstrips supply (d) London is centre of speculative market with overseas landlords and buy-to-let landlords who buy without intention to live in property (e) rise of private companies that manage airbnb properties in exchange for profit share |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   69,000 observations in London in June 2018, from which 50,000 (72%) have at least one review and can be considered as active. 55% are listings of entire rooms, 44% are private rooms, and 1% correspond to shared rooms.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Previous studies have found: (a) turnover of establishments are high, 49% exited after registering, (b) non-professional hosts (one listing instead of multiple listings) are 13.6% more likely to exit the market (c) caveat that difficult to quantify the overall evolution and growth of airbnb but shows how listings have cumulatively increased over the years.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Number of dwellings removed from the permanent rental market about half of current rental vacancy. |                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Urban planners should integrate short-term rental impacts into zoning and housing policies.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Ferreri & Sanyal (2018)](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/0042098017751982)                                                                                                       | London. Qualitative analysis of policy documents, Airbnb data, and interviews.                                                        | -   London exhibits “regulated deregulation”: Airbnb operates legally in practice with selective enforcement.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Gap between regulation and enforcement: even where rules exist (zoning, planning permission, restrictions on short-term lets), local authorities struggle to access the data sets held by platforms, monitor and enforce compliance. This creates “informal” or semi-informal spaces of platform use outside full regulatory control.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Shift toward “regulated deregulation” means that planning regimes become more flexible (or weaker) in response to platform pressures, raising questions about housing affordability, access, equity and the traditional urban planning remit.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Highlights need for coordinated urban governance to mitigate housing pressures.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Bivens (2019)](https://www.epi.org/publication/the-economic-costs-and-benefits-of-airbnb-no-reason-for-local-policymakers-to-let-airbnb-bypass-tax-or-regulatory-obligations/)                | US-wide. Literature synthesis and policy assessment.                                                                                  | -   Economic costs of Airbnb likely outweigh the benefits. costs to renters and local jurisdictions likely exceed the benefits to travellers and property owners.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Evidence that Airbnb increases the supply of short-term travel accommodations and slightly lower prices. But there is little evidence that the high price of travel accommodations is a pressing economic problem in the United States:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Instead, rising housing costs are a key problem for American families, and evidence suggests that the presence of Airbnb raises local housing costs.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Benefits:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |     \(1\) Property owners can diversify into short-term rentals and increase return on assets. However, housing wealth is primarily concentrated among the top 20%.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |     \(2\) Increased options and price competition for travellers accommodations. However, this is in effect a redistribution of welfare, and not an increase in overall economy wide welfare. Little effect on developers building more accommodation in the city but instead results in a conversion of long-term rental units into short-term rental units.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |     \(3\) Increased tourism spending and economic prospects of cities. However, relies on assumption that *all* spending done by travellers staying at Airbnb properties is spending that would not have been done had Airbnb not existed.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Costs:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |     \(1\) Long-term renters face higher housing costs.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |     \(2\) Local government tax collections fall                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |     \(3\) Externalities inflicted on neighbours                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                       | -   Policy interventions recommended to limit negative effects while retaining some economic benefits.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
